node.title: 'It's really challenging': Waiting 10 hours for the first cuddle
node.alt: Tamara holding Tide and Kove on her chest, purple beanies on the babies, Justin looking over her shoulder.
node.description: Tide and Kove were born prematurely at 34 weeks and are still at the hospital's specialist nursery. Their parents hope the whole family will be home by Christmas.
node.content:
["Tiny hands, delicate ears and minuscule toes \u2014 Tamara O'Donnell savours the fleeting experience of meeting her newborn sons for the first time.", "\"I had a moment where I looked at them for about 10 seconds \u2014 and then they were gone,\" she said.", "Tide and Kove were born at 34 weeks via caesarean section and whisked straight into incubators.", "", "
Ms O'Donnell says the birth of\u00a0Tide and Kove\u00a0has been completely different to her first son's arrival.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "It took 10 hours for the Rockhampton mother-of-three and her husband Justin to cuddle their twins, covered in tubes and ties, for the first time.", "\"It's a really challenging experience,\" she said.", "The O'Donnell twins are two of about 27,000 babies who will be born premature in Australia this year.", "", "
Tide and Kove will be able to go home once they are\u00a0big and strong enough.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "
Tide and Kove's splash into the world
", "Tide weighed 1.95 kilograms when he was born on November 10 and Kove arrived a little smaller at 1.5kg \u2013 confining him to an incubator\u00a0longer than his brother.", "", "
Kove has had to stay in the incubator for longer.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "\"There's a couple of little doors on the side that we can pop our hands through,\" Ms O'Donnell said.", "\"That's a little bit more challenging for cuddles and touches and things like that.", "\"They've got little fabric love hearts \u2014 I put them on myself to get my scent on them and then I can pop them in there with him so that he can smell me.", "\"That's really special.\"", "", "
Kove weighed 1.5 kilograms when he was born on November 10, 2021.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "Ms O'Donnell spent four days in hospital recovering, plus an extra night as a boarder, before being sent home to rest.", "\"That first night when I got home, I was really emotional,\" she said.", "\"I felt like I'd left a part of me at the hospital.", "\"That was really tough.\"", "", "
Ms O'Donnell says leaving the hospital\u00a0without her twins\u00a0is heartbreaking.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "
'The best job in the world'
", "The O'Donnells spend as much time with their babies as possible, only leaving for a few hours of sleep.", "But the \"amazing staff\" at Rockhampton Hospital's special care nursery (SCN) put their minds at ease.", "\"That is really heartwarming; when you go home at night and you know that somebody is in there treating them like they're their own children,\" Ms O'Donnell said.", "\"What more could you ask for?\"", "", "
Charlotte Lawrie has been a registered nurse at the unit for about a year.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "Charlotte Lawrie is a registered nurse at central Queensland's only SCN\u00a0and said it was \"the best job in the world\".", "\"I love all these babies so much,\" she said.", "Ms Lawrie said that her favourite part was\u00a0\"just watching these parents and babies reach those milestones\".", "\"The first cuddle, the first bath, the first bottle, the first breastfeed \u2013 all the firsts.", "\"From watching them come into the nursery as these tiny little prems (premature babies) and going home and achieving so many things.\"", "Ms Lawrie said emotional support and teaching were also a big part of her role.", "", "
Maxine Ballinger has met hundreds of premature babies\u00a0in the\u00a0Rockhampton Special Care Unit over the years.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "
Extra strain on regional parents
", "Maxine Ballinger, a clinical nurse consultant, said the SCN cares for babies from 32 weeks or 1,500 grams.", "\"They can be here from anywhere from a week to eight weeks before being discharged,\" she said.", "\"They need to be maintaining their own temperature and putting on weight and being able to maintain their weight.\"", "Smaller babies are sent several hours south to Brisbane or north to Townsville for specialist care, often forcing regional families to temporarily relocate.", "", "
Charlotte Lawrie, Maxine Ballinger\u00a0and Rachel Bennett\u00a0love working in the special care unit.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "About 350 babies go through the unit annually.", "\"Seventy-five per cent of those would be babies born under 37 weeks;\u00a0that's what's classed as pre-term babies,\" Ms Ballinger said.", "The care has evolved over the years, with local volunteers playing a big part.", "\"The little octopuses, they're knitted or crocheted specifically as a tight knit that the babies can hang on, so it's curled like an umbilical cord,\" she said.", "\"Unfortunately, these little ones want to grab anything near their face \u2014 their feeding tubes, their drips, even their own skin;\u00a0so, we just give them that, so they've got something to hang onto.\"", "", "
Tide O'Donnell weighed 1.95 kilograms when he was born on November 10, 2021.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "The unit has introduced reading and also runs a competitive book costume competition to brighten spirits.", "
The end goal
", "For first-time dad Mr O'Donnell, it has been \"an emotional rollercoaster\".", "\"Leaving them when you go home, you know they're in good hands,\" he said.", "", "
First-time dad Justin O'Donnell says he cries every day, but the good moments are breathtaking.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "\"[But] there hasn't been a day where I haven't cried more than three to four times.", "\"You see them getting jabbed with needles, different tubes going in and out \u2014 it breaks your heart.", "\"But then you see the good things and the days they do good, and it lifts you back up again.\"", "", "
The couple hopes to have Tide and Kove home in time for Christmas.(ABC Capricornia: Erin Semmler)
", "There are two empty spots in a decked-out nursery, ready for Tide and Kove when they are big and strong enough.", "\"Every single time we drive home we keep saying, 'Imagine how it's going to be when we've got the babies in the back seat',\" Ms O'Donnell said.", "\"We just keep looking at that goal.", "\"When we can walk out the hospital doors with the boys in our arms and just get everybody where we're supposed to be, altogether in the house.\"", "Hopefully just in time for Christmas."]
